msItem.title: Livre de la Vigne nostre Seigneur
msItem.note: A treatise on Antichrist, the Last Judgement, Heaven and Hell, comprising the final part ('le desrain liure') of a longer text.

Grenoble, Bibliothèque municipale, 337 (CGM 408) [digitized at PaGella] [digitized at Gallica] contains 'le premier livre de la Vigne Nostre Seigneur...et fut acompli le Ve jour de mars l'an M CCCC LXIII / Et est a savoir que le second livre fut premierement fait et acompli que cestuy qui est le premier' (see ARLIMA); this manuscript is from the Grande Chartreuse (Raymond Etaix in Scriptorium 42/1 (1988), 68). Grenoble, Bibliothèque municipale, 399 (CGM 409) , from the Dominican friary in Grenoble, contains another copy of Book 1; no other text of Book 2 is known.

Translation: End of Time in the Middle Ages: The Vineyard of Our Saviour - Bodleian MS. Douce 134, tr. Marijim Thoene and Guy Mermier (Michigan Publishing Services, 2022) (https://doi.org/10.3998/mpub.11767532).
msItem.rubric: (fol. ii, table of contents) Sensuit ce que est contenu en present desrain liure de la vigne nostre seigneur
Cy comence le desrain liure de la vigne nostre seigneur
msItem.incipit: Voca operarios ... comme le soir feust venu le seigneur de la vigne dist a son procureur les paroles proposees
msItem.explicit: et il demourra pour auoir son paiement de ses [in other hand: faultes]
msItem.textLang: Middle French (with extensive quotations in Latin)

decoDesc.decoNote: Initials. By several hands, the later one at the end of the manuscript related to Chantilly, Museé Condé, Fr. 495. (Pächt and Alexander i. 710, pl. LIV)

binding.p: Contemporary (?) binding of bevelled wooden boards covered with brown leather, rebacked, with incised decoration including flowers and inscription 'dominus Johannes Blathe' possibly added slightly later. Four bosses, with fixture for a clasp which fastened to a pin in the centre of the back cover.

history.provenance: 'Dominus Johannes Blathe', incised on the binding.
Gilbert Paignon Dijonval (d. 1792); Charles-Gilbert, viscount Morel de Vindé (d. 1842); Dijonval-Morel Vindé sale, April 1823, lot 190.
T. F. Dibdin: two pages reproduced in his Reminiscences II (1836), p. 769.
'The library of a collector', at Evans, 28 May 1832, lot. 1423, bought by Payne for £19 15s.
Purchased from Payne by Douce in June 1832; '31. 10. 0' in pencil on the front pastedown, perhaps Payne's price.
history.acquisition: Bequeathed by Douce to the Bodleian in 1834.

recordHist.source: Adapted (2018) with some additions from The Douce Legacy (1984), no. 248; Pächt and Alexander (see Bibliography); and the Summary Catalogue (1897). Summary Catalogue, vol. 4, p. 532

availability.p: To ensure its preservation, access to this item is restricted, and readers are asked to work from reproductions and published descriptions as far as possible. If you wish to apply to see the original, please click the request button above. When your request is received, you will be asked to contact the relevant curator outlining the subject of your research, the importance of this item to that research, and the resources you have already consulted.

listBibl.bibl: Otto Pächt and J. J. G. Alexander, Illuminated Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library, Oxford, I (1966), no. 710

ref.title: JONAS: Répertoire des textes et des manuscrits médiévaux d'oc et d'oïl

revisionDesc.change: Description revised for publication on Digital Bodleian.
